t: Luke 4
The Temptation of Jesus
Jesus,*p full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led around by the Spirit in the wilderness
for forty days, being tempted by the devil. And He ate nothing during those days, and when they had ended, He became hungry.
And the devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”
And Jesus answered him, “It*r is*r written,*r ‘Man*sr shall*sr not*sr live*sr on*sr bread*sr alone*sr .’ ”*r
And*p he led Him up and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
And the devil said to Him, “I will give You all this domain and its glory; for it has been handed over to me, and I give it to whomever I wish.
Therefore if You worship before me, it shall all be Yours.”
Jesus answered him, “It*r is*r written,*r ‘You*sr shall*sr worship*sr the*sr Lord*sr your*sr God*sr and*sr serve*sr Him*sr only*sr .’ ”*r
And*p he led Him to Jerusalem and had Him stand on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here;
for it is written, ‘He*spn will*s command*s His*s angels*s concerning*s You*s to*s guard*s You,’*s
and,*p ‘On*pn their*i hands*s they*s will*s bear*s You*s up,*s So*sln that*s You*s will*s not*s strike*s Your*s foot*s against*s a*s stone*s .’ ”
And*p Jesus answered and said to him, “It*r is*r said,*r ‘You*sr shall*sr not*sr put*sr the*sr Lord*sr your*sr God*sr to*sr the*sr test*sr .’ ”*r
When*p the devil had finished every temptation, he left Him until an opportune time.
Jesus’ Public Ministry
And*p Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about Him spread through all the surrounding district.
And He began*i teaching in their synagogues and was praised by all.
And*p He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up; and as was His custom, He entered the synagogue on the Sabbath, and stood up to read.
And the book of the prophet Isaiah was handed to Him. And He opened the book and found the place where it was written,

“The*srpn Spirit*sr of*sr the*sr Lord*sr is*sr upon*sr Me,*sr Because*srln He*sr anointed*sr Me*sr to*sr preach*sr the*sr gospel*sr to*sr the*sr poor.*sr He*srln has*sr sent*sr Me*sr to*sr proclaim*sr release*sr to*sr the*sr captives,*sr And*rln recovery*sr of*sr sight*sr to*sr the*sr blind,*sr To*srln set*sr free*sr those*sr who*sr are*sr oppressed,*sr
To*srln proclaim*sr the*sr favorable*sr year*sr of*sr the*sr Lord.”*sr
And*p He closed the book, gave it back to the attendant and sat down; and the eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed on Him.
And He began to say to them, “Today*r this*r Scripture*r has*r been*r fulfilled*r in*r your*r hearing.”*r
And all were speaking well of Him, and wondering at the gracious words which were falling from His lips; and they were saying, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”

And He said to them, “No*r doubt*r you*r will*r quote*r this*r proverb*r to*r Me,*r ‘Physician,*r heal*r yourself!*r Whatever*r we*r heard*r was*r done*r at*r Capernaum,*r do*r here*r in*r your*r hometown*r as*r well.’ ”*r
And He said, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r no*r prophet*r is*r welcome*r in*r his*r hometown.*r

But*r I*r say*r to*r you*r in*r truth,*r there*r were*r many*r widows*r in*r Israel*r in*r the*r days*r of*r Elijah,*r when*r the*r sky*r was*r shut*r up*r for*r three*r years*r and*r six*r months,*r when*r a*r great*r famine*r came*r over*r all*r the*r land;*r
and*r yet*r Elijah*r was*r sent*r to*r none*r of*r them,*r but*r only*r to*r Zarephath,*r in*ir the*ir land*ir of*r Sidon,*r to*r a*r woman*r who*r was*r a*r widow.*r
And*r there*r were*r many*r lepers*r in*r Israel*r in*r the*r time*r of*r Elisha*r the*r prophet;*r and*r none*r of*r them*r was*r cleansed,*r but*r only*r Naaman*r the*r Syrian.”*r
And all the*i people*i in the synagogue were filled with rage as they heard these things;
and they got up and drove Him out of the city, and led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city had been built, in order to throw Him down the cliff.
But passing through their midst, He went His way.
And*p He came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and He was teaching them on the Sabbath;
and they were amazed at His teaching, for His message was with authority.
In the synagogue there was a man possessed by the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
“Let us alone! What business do we have with each other, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”
But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be*r quiet*r and*r come*r out*r of*r him!”*r And when the demon had thrown him down in the midst of*i the*i people,*i he came out of him without doing him any harm.
And amazement came upon them all, and they began*i talking with one another saying, “What is this message? For with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits and they come out.”
And the report about Him was spreading into every locality in the surrounding district.
Many Are Healed
Then*p He got up and left*i the synagogue, and entered Simon’s home. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Him to help her.
And standing over her, He rebuked the fever, and it left her; and she immediately got up and waited on them.
While*p the sun was setting, all those who had any who*i were*i sick with various diseases brought them to Him; and laying His hands on each one of them, He was healing them.
Demons also were coming out of many, shouting, “You are the Son of God!” But rebuking them, He would not allow them to speak, because they knew Him to be the Christ.
When*p day came, Jesus left and went to a secluded place; and the crowds were searching for Him, and came to Him and tried to keep Him from going away from them.
But He said to them, “I*r must*r preach*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r to*r the*r other*r cities*r also,*r for*r I*r was*r sent*r for*r this*r purpose.”*r
So*p He kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
